description: Four more Democrats call on Biden to step aside. French voters keep far right at bay. Beryl heads to Texas. California is creating too much solar energy.
title: Here's the biggest news you missed this weekend

description: Besting all expectations, France’s leftist coalition pulled off an upset victory over the populist National Rally that quelled, for now, fears of a far-right takeover in a nation with a long history of keeping the far right out of government and at society’s fringes.
title: France's far-right firewall holds, but with signs of cracks

description: WASHINGTON — Four additional Democrats in Congress told their lawmaker colleagues during a phone call Sunday that they believe President Joe Biden should step aside to allow someone else to be the party's nominee for president, according to multiple people on the call and familiar with the discussion.
title: Four more Democrats in Congress call for Biden to step aside in 2024 race

description: A long-running heat wave that has already shattered previous records across the U.S. will persist, baking parts of the West with dangerous temperatures that will soar into the 100s and holding the East in its hot and humid grip throughout the week, forecasters said Sunday.
title: Persistent heat wave in the U.S. expected to shatter new records as it bakes West and swelters in East

description: NBC News’ Matt Bradley was among the first international journalists to be embedded with the Israeli Defense Forces inside the city of Rafah in southern Gaza. Israeli forces said they are trying to block tunnels used by Hamas under the Gaza and Egyptian border to smuggle contraband and weapons.
title: NBC News looks at fighting in Rafah as war enters ninth month

description: Los Angeles Lakers star LeBron James signed an extension to remain with the franchise, officials confirmed on X Sunday, leading to a potential NBA first of father-son teammates.
title: LeBron James signs deal to stay with Lakers, opening door to first father-son teammates in NBA history

description: Two people were killed and 17 others were injured in a shooting during a block party in Detroit, Michigan early Sunday morning.
title: 2 killed, 17 others injured in a shooting at Detroit block party

description: Sen. JD Vance, R-Ohio, on Sunday said former President Donald Trump has not spoken to him about joining his campaign as his vice presidential pick.
title: Sen. JD Vance says he has ‘not gotten the call’ from Trump asking to be his VP

description: John Cena offered a heartfelt speech of gratitude to his wrestling fans Saturday night as he declared his retirement from the ring, declaring next year's WWE WrestleMania his final one.
title: John Cena announces official retirement from wrestling, declaring the next WrestleMania his last

description: Rep. Adam Schiff (D-Calif.) tells Kristen Welker during an exclusive interview with Meet the Press that both President Joe Biden and former President Donald Trump should be willing to take cognitive tests.
title: Biden and Trump should 'be willing' to take cognitive tests, says Rep. Adam Schiff

description: Target Circle Week 2024 is back with savings you won't want to miss! Unlock the best deals and score deep discounts.
title: Shop these Target Circle Week deals before they’re gone

description: Pope Francis denounced populist politics and what he called “the dross of ideology” on Sunday, warning that democracy was not in good shape in many parts of the world.
title: Pope decries populists, warns democracy is in bad health

description: Marking nine months since the war in Gaza started, Israeli protesters blocked highways across the country Sunday, calling on Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to step down and pushing for a cease-fire that could bring back the hostages held by Hamas.
title: Israeli protesters block highways, call for cease-fire to bring back hostages as war marks 9 months

description: As California works towards its ambitious clean energy vision, an almost counterintuitive challenge has emerged: The state is, at times, generating more solar than it can handle.
title: Too much solar? How California found itself with an unexpected energy challenge

description: As the climate crisis pushes temperatures higher, some popular destinations are extending their peak seasons and cooler locales are seeing summer demand surge.
title: Extreme heat is changing where and when we vacation

description: NIAMEY, Niger — Military junta leaders of Niger, Mali and Burkina Faso on Saturday ruled out returning their nations to the West Africa regional bloc whose division could further jeopardize efforts to undo coups and curb violence spreading across the region.
title: Military leaders of Niger, Mali and Burkina Faso rule out returning to the ECOWAS regional bloc

description: At least 16 people were killed in an Israeli strike on a school sheltering displaced Palestinian families in central Gaza on Saturday.
title: Israeli strike kills 16 at Gaza school, military says it targeted gunmen
